name: places/ChIJw0iarSJawokRYslMIjGxy1o
formattedAddress: 88 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 88 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038-2807, USA

originalText.text:
Let me start off by saying that I love this banya. I have probably been ~10 times in the last year. I recommend it all the time. This review is purely for an incident that happened earlier tonight. When I went back to the locker room at the end of the day, I showered and returned to a black liquid bubbling out of the drain and pooling out onto the floor in front of my locker. I don‚Äôt think it was sewage but it smelled wretched. I put a towel down and in my sandals stood there transferring everything out of the locker to the bench. It was so disgusting I felt like even the bottom of my shoes would have to be cleaned before taking them home. When I went upstairs to pay I brought this to the attention of two women behind the desk and showed them pictures. One was very kind and assured me (unconvincingly) that it was not unsanitary. The other immediately snapped and asked if it‚Äôs such a problem why didn‚Äôt you tell us sooner? I told her it only just happened. She repeated herself. I said that for a $65 entry price (not including $50 more for food and drink) it was completely unacceptable. She barked at me again saying that it must not have been bad or I would have alerted them sooner. In the end she took $5 off my $200 bill (entry + food for my partner too). This was almost more offensive than her initial response. I‚Äôm not someone out to get a discount, I just shouldn‚Äôt have to trudge through smelly wastewater to gather my things. The experience has completely soured me, which is a shame.

Previously, I would say Spa 88 is my favorite thing about living in NYC (seriously). I love the grimey tiles, the Windex spray bottles, the furnace of a sauna. It is a fascinating cross section of New Yorkers with some of the best people watching and eavesdropping the city has to offer. I look forward to eating pickled herring and potatoes coated in raw garlic. You put up with a lot, sure (only two or three out of the women‚Äôs showers are ever working), but I always said it‚Äôs worth it for the food, the schvitz, and the people. When my sister and I got plantar warts on the bottom of our feet from their sandals I started bringing my own flip flops. But the mysterious spillage and nasty response was a huge bummer. These guys are printing money. Either lower your prices or raise your standards.

originalText.text: Good place for relax  and health . Good saunas and swimming pools . Traditional food is very tasty , especially solyanka . They also sell alcohol. Towels, bathrobes, slippers are also available to the guests of the bathhouse. Special thanks to the administrator Maria - professional.

text.text: Good place for relax  and health . Good saunas and swimming pools . Traditional food is very tasty , especially solyanka . They also sell alcohol. Towels, bathrobes, slippers are also available to the guests of the bathhouse. Special thanks to the administrator Maria - professional.

originalText.text:
Let's just say, you get what you pay for. BUT I thoroughly enjoyed my time at Wall St (aka Russian Bath House). The front desk staff are very matter of fact. Believe this to be the nature of their Russian descent. No niceties, just the facts. Short, blunt and to the point. The facilities are just okay. Don't expect luxury. The property is VERY worn - lots of missing tiles in the walls and tubs. If you are a germophobe, don't go. While I did not feel it was dirty,  it certainly was not sparkling. But in the very damp atmosphere no mold was present  The collection of felt hats for sale is a great addition. If you know why these are worn in the bath house, you will be more appreciative of seeing them.
There are several areas to enjoy. The eucalyptus steam room was awesome! The svitz sauna awesome! There was a hotter sauna (194 degrees!!!) that was WOW! I purchased an add on treatment of the oak leaves (platka? Something like that). It was an AMAZING experience and would do again!! The pool was great. Hot tub so-so...not a lot of jets. The cold sauna was phenomenal! Not sure the name of that, but essentially has cold frozen pipes inside that process a unique cooling experience. The infrared sauna was nice, but very narrow seats and uncomfortable. Lastly... The plunger pool üò≥. I have no idea at what temp this kept, but they continued to dump huge buckets of ice in it during our visit!
There is a restaurant on site which we did not try.
There is a bear with refreshments...we tried several of the infused vodkas. Ginger was my favorite.
So, go with an open mind! The quality of the property (old/worn) would have garnered only 3 stars. The added treatment and experience in general bumped it up to 4 stars.
Would go again!
*No photos are allowed outside of the lobby area

originalText.text:
This is my new favorite spot. It was very clean, the saunas and steam rooms were very hot, several options of temperature too, and great cold plunge.
It is no frills, but such a chill, relaxing environment. The food at the restaurant downstairs is incredibleeeee - I would come back just for that!! Seriously.
Everyone was super nice, respectful and even made a few friends there. Absolutely will be back!

originalText.text: They require and insist on some sort of "security deposit" of value. In my case they took my driver's license and my credit card as the hostage. Made me uncomfortable. Do they automatically assume I'll just leave without paying them? Otherwise it was good.
